title: 71% of Indian consumers intend to shop online this festive season: report
description: According to a survey by market research firm Ipsos Research, commissioned by Amazon India, 71% respondents indicated they plan to shop online this festive season, while 89% expressed excitement about the upcoming festivities.
content: As brands prepare for an anticipated surge in sales during the upcoming festive season, more Indian consumers intend to shop online, according to a survey by market research firm Ipsos Research, commissioned by Amazon India.Among the respondents, 71% indicated they plan to shop online this festive season, while 89% expressed excitement about the upcoming festivities.Reflecting a rise in consumer confidence and intent to shop, nearly 50% of respondents planning to shop online said they would spend more on festive shopping this year compared to last. This trend spans metros, with 55% planning to increase spending, and tier-two cities, where 43% (from cities with populations between 1 and 4 million) echoed the same sentiment.“The months leading up to the festivities are significant as many major shopping explorations and purchase decisions occur during this time. This period also presents an opportunity for us to delight customers with vast selection, great value coupled with highly trusted and seamless shopping experience which reflects evolving customer preferences,” said Saurabh Srivastava, vice president – categories at Amazon India.The survey highlighted convenience as a major driver of online shopping in India. Of the respondents, 76% appreciated the ability to shop remotely, 74% valued speedy delivery, 75% trusted online shopping events for providing original products, and 75% cited affordable payment options, such as no-cost EMI, as factors encouraging them to shop online during the festive season.
